page.title: 20WILD FLOWERS OF THE AREA
page.content: CROSS-LEAVED HEATH, BELL HEATHER AND LING (HEATHER), BILBERRY, CROWBERRY, SEDGES AND THEE INVASIVE BRACKEN ALL GROW ON THE ACID SOIL OF THE MOOR. LESS COMMON ARE SUNDEW, CHICKWEED WINTERGREEN AND THE HEATH SPOTTED ORCHID. ON THE RISING GROUND GROW THE RASPBERRIES AND BRAMBLES, AND ON THE MARSHY GROUND THE HYBRID OF THE SPOTTED AND MARSH ORCHID TOGETHER WITH MILKMAID, RAGGED ROBIN, BOG BUTTERCUP AND CRESSES. DISTRIBUTED ON THE MARGINAL LAND, ROADSIDES, EDGES OF FIELDS AND WOODS, GROW A VARIETY OF PLANTS INCLUDING; THISTLES, DANDELION, DAISY, BUTTERCUP, FUMITORY, SHEPHERD'S PURSE, RED CAMPION, HERB ROBERT, BROOM, GORSE, VETCHES, BIRDSFOOT TREFOIL, SILVERWEED, WILD AND BARREN STRAWBERRIES, WILD ROSES, HAWTHORNE, WILLOWHERB, GOOD KING HENRY, COW PARSLEY, PIGNUT, NETTLES AND DANDELION
